title: Head Start & Early Head Start
shortDescription: Federally funded early childhood programs that reserve at least 10% of enrollment for children with disabilities.
description: Head Start and Early Head Start are free, federally funded programs that promote school readiness for children from low-income families. While not autism-specific, federal law requires every Head Start program to reserve at least 10% of its enrollment for children with disabilities, including autism spectrum disorder. Many Head Start centers provide developmental screenings, individualized education plans, on-site therapy referrals, and inclusive classroom environments. For families in rural or underserved areas where specialized autism programs may not exist, Head Start can be a critical bridge to early intervention and support services.
benefits: Federal mandate to reserve 10% of slots for children with disabilities
Developmental screenings and referrals to early intervention
Family support services including parent education
Transition planning to kindergarten and school-based services
whoCanBenefit: Children ages birth to 5 from low-income families
Children with autism or developmental delays who need inclusive childcare
Families in rural areas with limited access to specialized autism programs
Families seeking free early childhood education with disability accommodations
Pregnant women (Early Head Start prenatal services)
importantNote: Head Start is not an autism-specific program. Services and accommodations for children with disabilities vary by location. Families should contact individual centers to discuss their child's specific needs and what supports are available.
